Html:
Is google earth blocking people from getting the maptiles?  it seems after very little use, it stops working.

Is it possible to set the User-Agent to mimic Google Earth and cause google to stop blocking?

radioman wrote:

GMaps.Instance.UserAgent = "xxx yyy";

Well, where to add this code? Will it fix the problem?
anywhere you want, but i didn't test it

nah. i wish.

Well, i have tested. it doesn't work - nothing changes. any ideas?
is the tile source from Google Earth the same as from maps?

I wont be able to check until Monday..

If anyone wants to check in the meantime what tile server google earth is doing..

download a memory reader (http://www.artmoney.ru/),

select google earth as the process

search for google.com

should give you a bunch of results.... right click on one and click Memory Editor....

Keep clicking "Next" on the bottom left until you see one that looks like a tile server.

radioman wrote:

is the tile source from Google Earth the same as from maps?

If I understand You - yes, the same. For ex. - just select "Google Satellite" (map of entire world) in comboBox of Your example project for windows Forms - there is a picture. Then zoom in twice - there is no picture. And if we select "Google Maps" - all is Ok. But when I was beginning tests - all was Ok with Google Satellite too.

..i have checked google earth http requests with fiddler and they are totally different than from browser ;/

but strange, i just browsed few zooms in browser and they banned me ;] so wtf how they imagine that i'm bot ;/

radioman wrote:

..i have checked google earth http requests with fiddler and they are totally different than from browser ;/

but strange, i just browsed few zooms in browser and they banned me ;] so wtf how they imagine that i'm bot ;/

Gmmm... They banned You, then You were browsing via standard browser? Like IE, Mozilla, Opera? They never ban me while I use standard browser. If soo - let's think a little. May be You have included into code some identifier (i have not yet looked Your http requests in GMap), and now we all (!!!) are identified as ONE PERSON? I compile, run project, You run, iifuzz runs, etc. - we all use one identifier, create too many requests - and guys think: Hey!!! This is a bot!!!
the GoogleMapsAPIKey is not used to get tiles, only for geocoding

Try this for the user agent

GMaps.Instance.UserAgent = "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.9.1.7) Gecko/20091221 Firefox/3.5.7"

Cheers
